metadata.title: CVE-2014-1537 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in themozilla::dom::workers::WorkerPrivateParent function in Mozilla Firefoxbefore 30.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause adenial of service (heap memory corruption) via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-globalmenu - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
firefox-testsuite - 30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '30.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.3').
